gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਮਾਤਾ ਪਿਤਾ ਨ ਬੀਚਾਰਤ ਬਿਕਾਰ ਸੁਤ ਪੋਖਤ ਸਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਬਿਹਸਤ ਬਿਹਸਾੲਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Maataa Pitaa N Beechaarat Bikaar Souta , Pokhat Sapraym Bihasat Bihasaai Kai ?
translation: Just as the parents take no notice of the faults of their son and bring him up in happy and pleasant atmosphere.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਬ੍ਰਿਥਾਵੰਤ ਜੰਤ ਬੈਦਹਿ ਬ੍ਰਿਤਾਂਤ ਕਹੈ ਪਰਖ ਪਰੀਖਾ ੳੁਪਚਾਰਤ ਰਸਾੲਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Bridaavant Jant Baidahi Britaant Kahai , Parakh Pareekhaa Oupachaarat Rasaai Kai ?
translation: Just as a patient suffering from pain explains his ailment to the physician, ignoring his carelessness in maintaining his health, the physician administers medicine lovingly after thorough investigation,

gurmukhi: ਚਟੀਅਾ ਅਨੇਕ ਜੈਸੇ ੲੇਕ ਚਟਿਸਾਰ ਬਿਖੈ ਬਿਦਿਅਾਵੰਤ ਕਰੈ ਪਾਧਾ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਸੈ ਪੜਾੲਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Chateeaa Anayk Jaisay Ayk Chatisaar Bikhai , Bidiaavant Karai Paadhaa Preeti Sai Parhaai Kai ?
translation: Just as there are many students in a school, the teacher does not look into their childish pranks and nuisance but teaches them devotedly to make them knowledgeable,

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰਸਿਖਨ ਕੈ ਅੳੁਗੁਨ ਅਵਗਿਅਾ ਮੇਟੈ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਸੈ ਸਹਜ ਸਮਝਾੲਿ ਕੈ ॥੩੭੮॥
transliteration: Taisay Gursikhan Kai Aougoun Avagiaa Maytai , Braham Bibayk Sai Sahaj Samajhaai Kai ?378?
translation: So does the True Guru bless the Sikhs in His refuge with divine knowledge and high state of equipoise, thus obliterating their ill deeds performed in ignorance.  (378)
